title: Missal, use of Sarum (fragment)
description: Decoration: numerous initials in burnished gold or blue; extensive penwork.
genre: Medieval and Renaissance Manuscript Fragments in Beinecke Library
Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts in Beinecke Library
references: Missal, Use of Sarum (Fragment) (Takamiya MS 81). General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.
provenanceUncontrolled: Purchased from Toshiyuki Takamiya on the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, 2017.
indexedBy: A handlist of western Medieval manuscripts in the Takamiya collection / Toshiyuki Takamiya, in The Medieval book: glosses from friends & colleagues of Christopher de Hamel, ed. by Richard Linenthal, James Marrow and William Noel. 't Goy-Houten: Hes & De Graff, 2010, pp. 421-437.
abstract: Manuscript leaves from a Sarum missal, containing text from Masses for the third and eighth Sundays after Pentecost and for the dedication of a church
